TITLE: Installing and Running the Sveltos Dashboard Project
DESCRIPTION: Basic commands to clone the repository, install dependencies, and run the development server or build for production.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
cd dashboard
npm install
npm run dev
npm run build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Sveltos Dashboard with kubectl
DESCRIPTION: Command to apply the Sveltos dashboard manifest to a Kubernetes cluster using kubectl. This will deploy the dashboard components in the projectsveltos namespace.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
kubectl apply -f https://raw.githubusercontent.com/projectsveltos/sveltos/main/manifest/dashboard-manifest.yaml
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring HTTPS Protocol for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Sets the backend protocol to HTTPS. The default protocol is HTTP.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
set VITE_BACKEND_PROTOCOL= https
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Backend Name/IP for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Sets the backend name or IP address environment variable for the application. The default value is 'localhost'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
set VITE_BACKEND_NAME
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Backend Port for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Sets the backend port environment variable for the application. The default backend port is 9000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
set VITE_BACKEND_PORT={port}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Configuring Frontend Port for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the project on a specific port. If the specified port is not available, it will automatically switch to the next available port.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run dev -- --port {port}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example of Setting Backend Name for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set the backend name to 'ui-backend' instead of the default 'localhost'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
set VITE_BACKEND_NAME= ui-backend
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example of Setting Backend Port for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to set the backend port to 8000 instead of the default 9000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
set VITE_BACKEND_PORT=8000
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Example of Setting Frontend Port for Sveltos Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to run the development server on port 3000.
SOURCE: https://github.com/projectsveltos/dashboard/blob/main/development.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
npm run dev -- --port 3000
```
